intro: Spilanthes glaberrima, commonly known as the rough spilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes within the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying native plant communities.
